artist: Artist: Unknown Artist (Siena), 1540-50; Artist: Formerly attributed to Domenico Beccafumi
description: mounted on ivory paper with blue overmat; two kneeling male figures in foreground, with short hair; four standing figures behind--two with beards, one in partial shadow, one balding, with a walking stick
inscription:

LLC, in brown: untranslated inscription
medium: Pen and brown ink and brown wash
provenance: [Richard Day, London, until 1983; sold July 8 as Domenico Beccafumi' for Â£4,500, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1983-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Group of Men Looking to the Right
